duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and implement strategies to grow trusted-advisor relationships and facilitate an exceptional client experience.
Support the Client Leads to support strategic execution and work with the client's legal operations teams as needed.
Lead and track multiple, complex sets of client relationship activities, including RFPs, new business opportunities, client events, and custom client marketing efforts.
Work with finance and pricing teams to understand client requirements, account financial metrics, and pricing arrangements.
Plan and lead recurring internal team meetings and manage agenda preparation and tracking follow-up items.
Develop and provide regular client relationship reporting focused on key metrics, strategic actions, impact, and client satisfaction for both firm leadership and the client team.
Plan and lead internal client account team meeting agenda, team newsletters, share sites, and other communications.
Ensure accurate and appropriate client relationship, experience, and contact information is maintained in firm systems.
Develop and maintain onboarding for new attorneys to the client team.
Lead and oversee the coordination of supporting Business Services teams, ensuring effective knowledge-sharing, and increased efficiencies across the account.
Manage and mentor staff, as assigned, and oversee personnel issues, workload, and professional development of staff.
Regular interaction with lawyers around the firm, attendance at firm and client meetings, periodic travel to client locations, and other travel.
Work with legal project management to ensure processes and systems efficiently and effectively deliver an excellent client experience.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Master’s degree (MBA, MA, MS JD, or other relevant graduate degree) preferred.
